bioghist.p: Herman Skolnik (Ph.D. University of Pennsylvania) was a research chemist at Hercules, Inc. Research Center. He was editor of the American Chemical Society's Journal of Chemical Information and Computer Science for its first 22 years, and was the editor of the terpene chemistry section of Chemical Abstracts for more than 30 years. He was interested in chemical documentation, history of science, terpenes, heterocyclics, and azeotropy. Skolnik was the historian/archivist of the Delaware Section of the American Chemical Society, and lectured and published on the history and teaching of science.

scopecontent.p: This collection includes reprints of Skolnik's publications, company newsletters, clippings of journal articles, copies of the Del-Chem Bulletin (newsletter of the Delaware Section of the ACS), chemistry reference books, a company history of Hercules, Inc., audiocassettes of Skolnik's 1986 interview of Paul W. Morgan for the Chemical Heritage Foundation's Oral Histories project, slides to accompany lectures on chemistry and chemistry education, materials relating to the Scientists in Residence Program in the Delaware public school system, notes from meetings of ChemVets (a group of retired ACS members working to promote science education), and a wooden plaque of the Hercules Powder Company logo.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
